definition: key moment/decisive opportunity
early/prior/former/in advance/first
machine/engine/opportunity/intention/aircraft/pivot/crucial point/flexible (quick-witted)/organic/CL:臺|台[tai2]
surname Ji

sentences.english: You will take a chance in something in the near future.
sentences.chinese: 在不远将来发生的事情中你会占足先机。

sentences.english: Let's anticipate the enemy's move and occupy that city.
sentences.chinese: 我们要制敌先机抢先攻占那个城市。

sentences.english: Certainly, it can't rule out some people wanna be leading-edge by starting to talk.
sentences.chinese: 当然，并不排除有些人先开口想占尽先机。

sentences.english: So here are some tips to give you a head start.
sentences.chinese: 那么，以下是一些能让你占得先机的小贴士。

sentences.english: Remember maintaining a healthy lifestyle gives you a head-start on beating stress.
sentences.chinese: 记住，坚持健康的生涯方法能给你克服压力的先机。

sentences.english: Our philosophy base on fine creativity, grasp the chance and win the future.
sentences.chinese: 我们的信念是“创造卓越，赢得先机，赢是未来”。

sentences.english: The offerer is even advantaged in an acquisition from end to end.
sentences.chinese: 收购人更是在许多方面占尽先机。

sentences.english: The Chinese have the early advantage in executing cyber warfare.
sentences.chinese: 中国在开展网络战争中占有先机优势。

sentences.english: They develop leads by building relationships gradually over time.
sentences.chinese: 他们通过逐步建立关系网，占领先机。

sentences.english: Preemptive strikes are okay when you know for sure what you're preempting.
sentences.chinese: 当你确信你所占的先机，先发制人未尝不可。

sentences.english: For the government, the task is to get ahead of the crisis.
sentences.chinese: 对政府来说，首要任务就是要快速反应，抢占先机。

sentences.english: But it should move fast. Rivals have a head start.
sentences.chinese: 但它应该赶快行动，因为竞争对手已经占得先机。

sentences.english: The art of trading exists in stacking the odds in your favor and building an edge.
sentences.chinese: 交易的艺术在于积累有利于你的可能性并占得先机。

sentences.english: Many competitors advance to the next round.
sentences.chinese: 许多竞争对手在下一轮竞争中可能抢得先机。

definition: to seize (the strategic high ground)
initiative (as in "seize the initiative")/advantageous position that allows one to call the shots
leadership (role)
favorable location/in the right place/productivity of land
to gain the initiative by striking first (idiom); to preempt/to anticipate/preemptive
lit. late-comer lives above (idiom); the up-and-coming youngster outstrips the older generation/the pupil surpasses the master
on the up/currently winning/rising (in popularity etc)
to rush (to do sth urgent)/to try to be the first/to forestall
to seize the opportunity/to strike while the iron is hot
grasp it and victory is assured/to have success within one's grasp (idiom)
invincible position
to stand firmly/to gain a foothold/to establish oneself
to observe and make sure/to check
the time is right, geographical and social conditions are favorable (idiom); a good time to go to war
pinyin: tian1 shi2 di4 li4 ren2 he2

definition: to take advantage of a favorable situation/to seize an opportunity
(acknowledged) place/a role to play/niche
